content: Love this game but if dev is going to take your money they should keep the game up to date. No updates since 2017.
Dear developer... Please update this app... I cannot open it anymore.
Doesn't work on Pixel 4a. Crashes on startup
I enjoy this game a lot. And it was working perfectly, until it stopped. I can't even get into the game anymore. I uninstalled and reinstalled.

Paperback is an excellent deck building game and this is a fairly faithful port. It's missing some features like attack cards and expansions / optional rules. The online play could also be better. Lobby is cluttered by very old games and there's no notification to tell you when it's your turn.
Wth is this?

Really fun game and gets the mind going. I do have just 2 complaints. First, the game would obviously need to be consistently updated with any and all new word discovered in real life since the game's release. Second, being able to delete all the old game lobbies from 2-3 years ago. Other than that, this game is cool. I even have the physical megane as well
A very good implementation of the card game. The AI could be better, but you can still lose. So it's better than most strategy game AIs.

Great game, with a decent AI, but much better online play. Please remove the months old incomplete games from the list of games available. There should be a 2 month expiry at most for people to join a game.
Excellent game and implementation. BUT not working properly with latest android update. 5 stars if they fix this.
multiplayer is terrible. my partner bought it and we couldnt play together online
Quite like it! A bit depending on luck, but overall nice and clever.
When trying to login, repeatedly get "Invalid email/password" despite resetting the password.
Great experience.

A scrabbler kind of word gamewhere longer and high scoring words take time to build. Start with small words and depending on how you build your library of letters score higher next time. It's a race between players to score and bank your high scores. The app is really easy to use. There are different mechanics to learn so the start takes time to understand. The ai is nicely curved so the easy ai is good to start and the smartest ones will pull out impossible words to put you on your back foot.
Still my favorite time-waster while waiting in line or at a restaurant. Pass and play means my wife can get in on it too. Highest difficulty setting is shockingly challenging.
Please update.

I love the boardgame but unfortunately the app is abysmal. I played two games and now it just crashes on opening. I've reinstalled multiple times and contacted Devs to no avail. A shame because the game is great.
Doesn't work Galaxy Note 9
Great game, but notifications for online games don't work
Perfect game great offline mode. Highly recommend

Let me say that this is an AMAZING game, but a mediocre app. Single player works wonderfully, and pass and play works. HOWEVER, online was tacked on and is atrocious. You get no notification, and you get kicked to the lobby after every turn. It's a bit puzzling. I will say, that after 20 minutes of playing this, my wife and I agreed that we should purchase the physical copy along with its expansion.
It closes at statup on my Kindle!

Paperback is an overall fun game with a few drawbacks. 1. Notifications don't seem to be working on mobile. (Works fine on my Chromebook?) 2. Players are kicked to the lobby after every turn and cannot return to the game board until it's their turn again. This means that you can't review the score or the available letters cards while you wait for your opponent to take their turn. The game works fine otherwise. The app just pales in comparison to other digital board game conversions.
Great word-building game
Sadly, the app is borderline unplayable now. Used to love it, but it has this extremely blue tint on the game, which strains and hurts your eyes, and makes it difficult to play

Great version of a great game, with only one small caveat keeping it from a perfect score in digital form. Both Paperback and Hardback A.I. use words that are not allowed by the human players. Proper nouns are the biggest problems. It accepts it for them, but not the player. My wife and I have even tried using words that we saw the computer use and get scored, and we are not allowed. Other than that, both of these games are absolutely fantastic, especially for multiplayer with other humans!
interesting deck building word game. dictionary is decent. missing words such as trist and realtor.
I like the game, it's fun. however I've never been able to finish even one game, since the app closes in the middle of a game every single time. please fix this so I can finally enjoy this game

5 star game that needs an update — I think it's abandoned, which is a shame because i would really like to see the Unabridged expansion content added. there are still a few bugs too. The game crashes on Galaxy S8 occasionally, which results in the loss of the current game. Probably does that 1 on 20 plays.
I really like this game, but the color is off. It's a purple/blue screen. I hope that can be fixed. I'm using a Galaxy S9.

I love this game! A quick word came I can play while waiting for the train or in between work. The controls are very intuative if a bit slow at times, especially when buying cards at the end of the round. I do wish there was a high score tracker because I find that's where the appeal lies, overall score attack and getting high point words. Can't recommend this game enough
Great game but there's a constant deep blue tint on the game on my S9+, please fix this!
I love the game on my iPad but on my s9+ the game is all washed out with purple!! It's hard to see the cards. I've tried changing all kinds of display settings but it won't go away during gameplay
Love this game, only minus is i have to saying to read the fine print on the cards

I really like the physical card game and finding out that there was an app made it fun to play while on the go. My only issues are the coloring. There is some glitch (like others have mentioned) where i get a purple/blue tint to the entire screen. This makes it hard to see which buttons are the check marks and which are the Xs. I do also wish that the power/award/theme cards were integrated into the app version of the game.

Finally working multiplayer. Only thing that sucks (devs hope you are 
reading this), is you need to keep typing email and password for online. 
How about a "remember me" option? And when will we see the expansion?

Great game but the app doesn't feel fully developed. Are there any plans to 
add player stats and rankings? That would be a big plus in my book (like my 
play on words?).

Rating this a 4 despite one technical problem.  I really like the game and the app seems well designed.  But... the game has a habit of crashing, with random parts of the screen flashing and the game either not responding to taps (and if it does respond, I can't see the results).  I can sometimes recover by switching to the "choose-which-app-to-switch-to" Android view and then switching straight back to the game, but most often I have to close the game and restart.  As a result, I'm reluctant to take part in online multiplayer because I suspect that would be tedious for the other players.  So I'm stuck with the not-very-good AI, which I always beat.

Love the physical version of the game. It has a few glitches when combining 
power cards but other than that it's great.

Works OK, until you try to spell a word it doesn't know (like Antares or 
artisian).

Very fun game but glitchy on android. It would be nice to see a log of past 
games to see how much you win/lose and some stats. It would also be nice to 
be able to return to ended games to review plays.

With my Galaxy S9+ The game becomes unplayable. I get a purple screen which hides some of the button colors and is awful to look at. I played the game often on my S8+ with no problems.  Still nothing changed as of April 8. No response back to me and the game has not been fixed. I would like to play this game, but I can't as the purple color of the screen prohibits me from doing so.
Battery bugs. On my Pixel 2, Paperback consumes ~18% of battery in 10 minutes. Must fix in order to be playable.

To start, this is a great card game in the real world.  Buy the physical game.  The app? Its.....just ok.  I find the AI to be fine.  When playing a friend online? Wow, this gets super weird, super fast.  You get kicked out of the game when it isn't your turn.  (That's a shocker). You therefore cannot think about potential words while waiting.  This makes the game take longer.  I have the Burgle Bros app (another Fower game).  Seems good.  This one is just bizarre.  Why can't I just stay at the table and play? Hey, if it's .99cents....get it.  But, my advice is buy the real game.  Really, it's great.  Thus app needs work.
Love this game, though I miss the attacks from the tabletop version.  Lately the app crashes anytime I try to open it; please look into it.

Decent enough recreation of the physical version. The original is a phenomenal game, but the app can do with some work. AI is way too easy, so there's not much of a challenge there, and online is serviceable, but suffers from some odd game design choices, such as locking you out of the game while you wait for the other person. Graphically, the game is nice and retains the art style of the physical version, but it definitely feels like a print designer has done the design here as it is not very mobile friendly. Font and layout choices don't translate well to the small screen, so a number of adjustments should be made there. Besides this, it would be nice to have a clearer overview of things at all times. Also missing are the standard expansions, which I feel are actually not expansions, just part of the main game that you work your way towards while learning it - these should definitely be part of it. At this stage, even though a little bit of fun can be had with it, I don't feel it is worth the money.

This is an excellent version of the game that allows for some online play. I'd like to see social media integration and possibly the option to use some of the expansions, but I can't complain about the basic gameplay.  I will say that for some reason, the app is a bit of a battery hog. Have to force stop or restart phone before work to stop the drain.
Great game but needs a few extras:  Leaderboard for playing against friends (best game, best word). And general leader board for best ever scores.
Its great! The word part (when you make a word) is my favourite part. Your aim is to get the most points.

Fun enough, love the mechanics of the strategy for the game. AI can often take 30-45 seconds to play, and the scoring for money doesn't always add up correctly. Would be great if polished up a little.
Great, light competitive deck-building  spelling game.
Love the game, but wish Online i could see the other players score during my turn. Thx for the turn notifications!
I am also having Red screen issues on my Galaxy Note 10.1.  Once solved this game will totally get a 5 from me.

The game is great, but it would be cool to have two choices for multi - regular (evenly paced back ' n forth) and casual (those players who like to take their sweet-a time between turns). Also, I wasn't able to save a solo game while playing/waiting for turn in multi. Is that a thing or just my older phone?

Great game! I love the gameplay. I'm having one issue though: every time I play the game everything is shaded over in red on the screen. It completely distorts the way everything looks, and anything on screen that's also red (like the red "x" on the cancel buttons) becomes invisible. If I can get that fixed, game becomes a 5 star no problem.
Love the new online multiplayer. Can't wait for the expansion to hit the app!
Lots of fun - I haven't tired of this yet after many plays.  Tends to make my phone a bit warm and drain the battery though

This is a good implementation of the card game. A few improvements would be nice... - see the game score in the list of active games - win/loss history - allow screen rotation - show the player name in the notification when it's your turn (currently happens only for invites and new games) - see the game state while waiting on the other player's turn

Would like to be able to zoom in on the cards as they are played instead of just when buying. I forget what the abilities are and can't read them so not playing that way. Would be much more strategic gameplay if the abilities could be used/readable.  Edit: just found if you long press you can read abilities.  Increased my rating!
Massive battery drain and does not close when exiting. Good game, but uninstalling due to power usage.

Love this game! First discovered it in a game board cafe. Great for fans of Scrabble, bananagrams, or Dominion! Can't wait for multiplayer! Please make it so that you can pay with your own friends and not random people.

HUGE amount of replayability for only $4. Perfect? No. It uses the Scrabble dictionary, so some perfectly acceptable words these days (e.g., 'inline') aren't allowed, yet the hardest AI will use words you've never heard of. But still loads of fun, and well worth the $4.  And you don't have to like Scrabble (I don't) to enjoy this. Look up the rahdo youtube video on it to get an idea how it plays.
I like this game a lot. I look forward to online play.
Love this game.

This game, and the digital implementation, is pretty awesome. Fairly minor gripes: I can't see my opponent's score on my turn and the dictionary is slightly lacking. Somewhat bigger gripe: The app is a serious battery killer for some unfathomable reason.  I can't even imagine why. All in all it is a very fine app regardless. Thank you.
Great
I would give this game 5 stars if it would reverse orientation, I can't play it while my device is plugged in, which is 95% of the time.
The game gets stuck for a couple minutes at the beginning screen, the rules never show up and neither do your cards.  I wasted money on this!

Nice looking game which makes a change from other word games. Since it takes a long time to play a whole game, it would be good to continue  where you left off, but it always crashes when I try to do this. It would be more fun if you could customise your player as well, with a name & a picture. With these two things fixed I would give 5 stars.

This game is great. I would love to see some more options though for customizing your game, such as playing to a certain victory point or after a number of turns. And prehaps also, after you played your hand, a button to see what would have be the best word to play. I love word games but my vocabulary is lacking, so an option like this would be a great learning tool for me. Definitely will puck up the paper version after such and excellent digital version  Oops now I give the app one star. Game keeps crashing on loading now. Even after a reinstall, still no joy.
Great little game. Very faithful to the actual game.

This may be my favorite word game ever. Deck building is expertly woven into the familiar make-a-word gameplay, adding a ton of depth without being overwhelming. Online multiplayer is unfortunately missing, but otherwise it is nearly flawless.

I've had the pleasure of playing this card game outside the app; this is a decent enough reproduction, and a fun way to pass twenty minutes. But as in most electronic word games, the devil is in the details... or rather, the dictionary. AI opponents make use of UK spellings when it suits them ("tyres" and "s" for "z" in some words), some proper names squeak through ("Romeo", "Tarzan", "Louis") and others do not ("Conan", "Oregon"), and if you're playing the "smarter AI"... Prepare to see some words that would have hardened Scrabble players growling, "Use that in an English sentence, you $#%#." Some are just obscure, some barely squeak by as "loaner words" (mostly obscure units of measure and currencies), but others... "senhor"? I'm sorry, no. Settle for "horse", like everyone else. I wish it was possible to modify the dictionary, if only for future games. Otherwise, "Paperback" is a perfectly enjoyable brain-bender.

Awesome game now digital.  Please bring the powers, attacks and rewards expansions and the solo and coop. Only complaint i have is that there is no online game play which is a huge negative for these types of games. That and it makes your phone hot and drains battery.
Fun game, good twist on a classic.
Probably the best word game out there. If you like words with friends or scrabble this is for you. I hope this gets updated with expanions
Great port of a great card game. Just wish it had online multiplayer.
Fun game, stability issues.
Been trying to find a hard copy to play at home.

Fun game for word lovers and deck builders. Some uncommon words I entered weren't recognised by the game ("baronic") but no big complaint. The highest level AI is good at making words but could be better at buying books. It often makes silly mistakes like buying a book to end the game even though it's losing.
It's a great game, but it suddenly stopped working.  I'm on Android 7.1.1. The game only shows the splash screen, then exits.

Paperback is a fun deck builder with a really great art style.  The digital version might be one of the best ways to play because it has a dictionary that checks your words for you.  Definitely give the game a try if you are getting tired of classic word games like Scrabble.    The things that I'd like to see the most in this game are:  multiplayer, achievements, and a high score list of your top words.
Other than a few words not being recognized it's a really solid game.
Faithful to the good card game. Weak AI, but the big problem is the ridiculous battery drain and overheating of phone. Won't play again until that's fixed.
Great implementation of the physical game. My only complaint is the AI is kinda dumb, even on the higher level. I've played over 20 times and have never lost.

The latest version of the game is much improved over the initial release. The AI has improved and is now a good challenge. It would be nice to have attack cards like the real game. If you need to drain your battery in a hurry or need some extra heat then play this game. It runs hit and burns through battery in no time flat. Hopefully they can address this next.
Needs an undo button. Needs the ability to zoom in on abilities of cards when playing them. And just nitpicking here, but the layout design is a little boring

Paperback is a great game, and this is a faithful reproduction of it in app form. However, it needs work. The main issue is that the battery drain is beyond excessive. I have no idea why an app of this nature would consume so much power.  Additionally, some of the text is too small to read, even on a 5.7 inch screen (Nexus 6p). There also appears to be no way to back out of letter selection on a wild card if said card is selected accidentally. Quicker or skippable animations would also be nice.

Love this app!  An excellent representation of a really fun card game.  I love that the art from the original game is incorporated.  It's simple to use with pretty good instruction.  I do wish it kept records of your best words, and it would be nice to be able to give players and AI nicknames.  I also really appreciate that this game is eligible for the "family library" so that my husband and I only had to buy it once to both be able to play it.
...the dictionary is a bit wonky. It does not have a lot of common words in it and does have a bunch I've never heard of (that only the smartest ai uses).

I'd like to see the ability to name players, as well as have the additional game variants from the official rules. I've also heard certain card types are missing from the real game, but I'm still kinda new myself?

This is a very good implementation of a very good game. My biggest gripe right now is that the screen is red for some reason, something that another reviewer had mentioned. Another this I would like to see implemented is that this game has a number of variations in the official manual, and I would love to see those implemented.  I'll increase my rating once the red screen issue has been resolved.

Booted up this app and got some music and a title screen, but all of the text renders as symbols and no menus or options appear anywhere. I don't think this app is ready for prime time on my HTC One M7.

This is a game I absolutely love, and seeing it in video game form is wonderful. However I cannot exit it on my phone unless I hit the home button. Hopefully that will be fixed next update, because otherwise the game is amazing.

EXCELLENT BUT SLOW GAME. Wonderful game. Brilliant. Unfortunately, I can not play with the smartest AI because the app crashes. Even with the middle AI, sometimes long seconds pass when the "AI is thinking". The opening screen also appear for almost 15 seconds before the game starts.

Good game which is a cross between Dominion and Scrabble. Unlike others, I found the AI gave me a good challenge. Already reported, but I also noticed that it made my tablet (Hudl 2) run hot which means that it soon drains the battery. Hopefully the programmer will address this issue
Great game
Multi-player on this would be AMAZING!

Anybody else getting a red screen for their Galaxy Note 10.1 ? I will surely rerate to a 5 when this situation is resolved. I have reinstalled it a dozen times and nothing changed. It's been a few days now with no response, come on guys, please fix !!!
Looking forward to online multiplayer and hopefully profiles with stat tracking.

Where's the Cooperative/Solitaire Mode that the board game has? I prefer playing a puzzle against the mechanics of a game, not playing against a digital AI, and with the cardboard version you can do this. Please say this feature is coming!

Great game, very faithful to the physical game. Only dinged a star because it needs an Undo button while it's still your turn. When riding the bus it's very easy to get bounced and accidentally tap a card you don't want.
Game is fun,  but the app makes both my phone and tablet very hot.  There's not much going on graphically so I don't understand this.   If this was fixed I'd rate it higher.  LG G3 and nexus 7
Does not wake up properly on a LG G4. Have to pull the battery to reset the phone.

My first game, I won 76, 29, 20, 17 against 3 "smart AI" players. That's absurd. It's otherwise a beautiful implementation. I would definitely raise the rating to 5 stars if the AI was made competitive.
Such a fun game. Only criticism is that the computer players are too weak. Would love to see online play supported.
The app freezes right after the loading screen. Will rerate if I ever get to play.

A good adaptation of a fantastic card game.  I won't dock points for lacking multiplayer support since I've heard it's coming.  I do wish there was an undo button, high score list, and the ability to be me rather than "Player 1."  I hope that, in addition to multiplayer, more game options are added later like the card game's solo/co-op variant and the attack cards. Those are all pretty minor complaints.  The AI is fine.  I easily beat the Easy and Smart AI.  I'm unsure how good the Smarter AI is.  I've played against it once and only lost by a single point.  On the other hand, by the end of the game it was using words like "verists" and "zill," so it may have only been luck that prevented me from getting clobbered.
I rarely review, but this one is a fun, faithful adaptation of the card game.  Not sad at all that I purchased this one!
I'm super excited for this game, but it won't open on my tablet!
Uses deck building such as in Dominion Ascension Star Realms and combines it with a word game.

Scrabble meets Dominion. Easily my favorite board game in my collection.   App plays great. AI is decent if not a little easy to beat. Very enjoyable app version of the game.  Suggestions: -Remove the fame score tracker. Part of the strategy is knowing if you should buy the last fame card or keep the game alive because you're in second. If you always know where you stand against the opponent, this choice gets too easy.  -Add a button or gesture to return all letters in the tray back to your hand. 5 of 6 letters in and I want to completely change my word means having to pull them all back one at a time. Could be streamlined.  -Add a hand shuffle button or gesture. I can move them around myself, I guess, but I like the shuffle feature in other word games.
True to the cardboard version, but faster and sleeker in digital form. It was very easy to learn how to play.
Love the card game, love this digital implementation.  Good job.
I love the card game and the app is a wonderful adaptation of it. Very nicely done!

So glad that Paperback is finally on Android.  The game plays well and the art looks great.  I will say that I hope that they continue to add features to the app like asynchronous multiplayer and many of the rule variants found in the full version soon.  Now on to Burgle Bros!  Disclosure: I was a beta tester for this app, but was not paid in any way (I even bought the app on my own).
